intro: Mentha inarimensis, commonly known as the Japanese mint, is a perennial herb native to Japan and Korea. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, ovate leaves that have a serrated margin. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pale blue or purple and bloom in the summer months. Mentha inarimensis is valued for its refreshing scent and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported cooling and digestive properties.
